author: @BeMyFirst
text: As a Mac user, you don't even have to use the /User/Username/nltk_data on mac terminal like you do when uploading a csv file. You can just type "nltk_data" on the terminal and badaboom there you go. You can do that for the data.py file too. Extremely simple.

author: @will1971a
text: Thanks for the tutorials.¬†  "Gutenberg" actually refers to Project Gutenberg (projectgutenberg.org), an online repository of about 50,000 out-of-copyright books that are free to download. NLTK comes with a sample pre-loaded. You can download lots of books in bulk to create your own corpus.
